page.title: 03Aychley Farm
page.content: Aychley Farm is situated in 366.5 acres of land.85 acres of this is used for potatoes,30 acres for silage grass and 69 acres for spring barley.The rest is mainly grazing grass. In front of the farm there is a reservoir which is 13 feet deep and holds 6 million gallons of water.The reservoir was dug out in 1978 and doesn't contain any fish.It fills up by rain water from drains under the fields and from the roofs.There are ducks and geese nesting on the banks of the reservoir. The farm buildings and the farm house were built in 1868. The farmer rolls his barley to feed his fat cattle.The farm has 16 hay bays. The underpass is used for driving cattle under the dual carriageway of the A.41 into the opposite field.
